name: La Jolie Brise Pizzeria at the Waterfront Hotel

reviews.text: My wife and I visited La Jolie Brise in the harbour at Baltimore for a late lunch. We missed the lunch hotel on the entry to the town and were recommended to try La Jolie Brise. First impressions were not good and it appeared to be more a take away than a restaurant with one cook / server in attendance. After sitting down and asked for our order, I asked for a beer and was told that this was not possible unless we dined in the bar which adjoined this cafe. It was a cafe, hotel and bar complex. The bar was comfortable with a well stacked and lit open fire. The tables were uncovered and we were provided with "tomato sauce" with our knives and forks. I ordered hake and chips whilst my wife had oysters. They had no mussels which we asked for. When the food arrived I was pleasantly surprised at the high quality of the fish and was quite impressed. This is not a place to celebrate or have a gourmet meal but is very good food and excellent value for money. Recommended for a light lunch. Would happily return.
reviews.title: Suprisingly Excellent Food

reviews.text: Had a salmon, seafood pizza here about a year ago. Was the nicest I ever had. Stunning views across Roaring Water Bay and even in April we were able to sit outside until late in the evening. Prices aren't cheap but quality and service is top notch.
reviews.title: Nicest Seafood Pizza Ever

reviews.text: If you get a pizza at La Jolie Brise watch out for the charges for extra toppings which are ridiculous & not mentioned on the menu or by the person taking the order. I ordered 2 Regina pizzas with extra olives & pepperoni on each. The 2 pizzas cost €21, which is fine, but the toppings came to €12! I make that out at about 60 cents an olive & the same per slice of pepperoni. What a rip-off! I wasn't the only person to get burned by this while we were there & my reaction is the same as the other person's, "you won't be catching me paying these prices again". Nice location but left a nasty taste in the mouth (and I don't mean the food).
reviews.title: Beware the extra charges

reviews.text: We had breakfast and lunch here during our week in Baltimore. Smoked Salmon, Scrambled eggs and good coffee... yum. The kids really enjoyed sitting outside eating Pizza and ice cream. The location is really excellent with a great view over the bay.
reviews.title: Great Breakfast, Great Pizza and Great Ice Cream :-)

reviews.text: Agree with all other reviewers - great pizza at La Jolie Brise. They also do fresh fish and on the nights we were there the options were cod, hake and haddock. Unfortunately the fish is served with a great big dollop of garlic butter on top which is melting by the time it gets to you. No mention of it on the menu or "Today's Specials" board - so be warn - "ask for it on the side!" and it seems to be served with all main dishes except for pizza!
reviews.title: Great pizza - watch out for the garlic butter!
As good as pizza should be
reviews.text: Easily best pizzeria in Cork if not Ireland.Nicest staff and great atmosphere.Get margharita pizza.Thank me later

reviews.title: Great pizza
reviews.text: Chinese chef, French owned, Irish waitress, and Italian food - the best place to eat in Baltimore. Pizzas had a Crispy base, tasty toppings and in our opinion good value for money. We did have a portion of fries which were small and expensive but to be honest the pizzas are plenty on their own. My only complaint would be that the tables need a good scrub or even plastic cloths which can be washed down.

reviews.title: Hyped up place but what a let down
reviews.text: Waited ages for a table - thought this was a good sign but alas no finally got a table,after soon wait order and eventually approx 50 mins later got our pizzas looked good but looks was all it got, soggy tasteless pizza, when we asked for garlic mayo for the crusts we got a

reviews.title: Flexible - thank you!
reviews.text: Bowl of garlic butter.... Yuk butter to dip soggy pizza crusts into I don't think so no garlic mayo in the house.Will not be rushing back. A disappointing expensive evening to top off our otherwise beautiful day in Baltimore !

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: My sister and I got here at 12.40 and realised to our horror that we could have got breakfast if we'd arrived ten minutes earlier - however the chef approached us as we waited for attention at the counter and he agreed to do breakfast for us anyway - we really appreciated this flexible attitude - the waitresses were also very pleasant and friendly, and the breakfast was good and good value. Generally a very good experience.

reviews.title: I don't like fish, so I stick to the pizza or chicken
reviews.text: Plenty to choose from if you like fish. There isn't a great selection if you don't, unless you like pizza. Worth a visit nonetheless

reviews.title: Pretty good...
reviews.text: Nice position, and the pizzas are good, but our chips were cold and there was nothing particularly special about the spot. Good for lunch I'd say. Good simple fare.
Great Pizza!
reviews.title: Best Pizza in Cork

reviews.text: I wouldn't stray too far off the pizza menu as the non-pizza dishes can be disappointing, but the pizza is superb.
reviews.title: Cheap, cheerful, delicious

reviews.text: If it's a day for sitting outside then the location is also fantastic.
reviews.title: Very poor service

reviews.text: There are few pleasures in live that compare to sitting outside La Jolie with a pizza and a pint while the sun sets over the harbour. Heaven.
reviews.title: I Love It
ok for a pizza but limited choice
reviews.text: Stick to pizza and you should be ok. I had moules and they were very average, also Dublin bay prawns were not great and tasted as if previously frozen - not worth the price.
Tables sticky and poor cutlery, old condiments etc.
reviews.title: lacking atmosphere and overpriced
Beaufort 4
reviews.text: All in all could be a done a lot better given its fantastic location and the limited dining options available on a sunday evening.

reviews.title: Fab Pizza & Fish
reviews.text: Sorry, we felt this place was overpriced - and lacked atmosphere. It reminded me of a bog standard 'chipper' that you'd find anywhere else in the country, but with very fresh fish. It cannot be denied that the fish is beautifully fresh, however ours was served with a tablespoon of garlic butter literally plonked on top, and the pizza was fine but again very standard. The view is lovely, but we were overcharged - not enough to make a fuss, for example we were charged 40 cent more for 2 cans of diet coke than was listed on the menu, and the same on a couple of other items. Service was efficient
